gov.nih.nlm.bioscores.core

Class GenericCoreferencePipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.bioscores.core.GenericCoreferencePipeline

  • public class GenericCoreferencePipeline
extends java.lang.Object
    The generic pipeline that can be used for coreference resolution.

    This pipeline deals with all four coreference types: CoreferenceType.Anaphora, CoreferenceType.Cataphora, CoreferenceType.Appositive, and CoreferenceType.PredicateNominative. It requires a directory of text files to process and the corresponding term annotations in brat standoff annotation format in the same directory. It does not perform any named entity recognition, since the framework is NER system-agnostic. The semantic type/group labels assigned by the NER system should have been introduced to the framework via coref.properties file in the top-level directory. The hypernym/event trigger word lists associated with these types/groups should also have been defined in the properties file for this pipeline to have some degree of success.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • generateCoreferenceChain

        public static void generateCoreferenceChain(Document doc,
                                            SurfaceElementChain chain)
        Adds a CoreferenceChain object to the document, given the textual units involved in it. It performs consistency checks, merges mentions into other coreference chains, and handles chains involving coordinated items.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document being processed
        chain - the chain of textual units

      • writeStandoffAnnotations

        public static void writeStandoffAnnotations(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem>> writeTypes,
                                            java.lang.String outFileName,
                                            Document doc)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes relevant semantic objects as standoff annotations to an output file.
        Parameters:
        writeTypes - the semantic object types to write
        outFileName - the output file to write to
        doc - the document that contains the semantic objects
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if outFileName cannot be opened

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a list of corresponding standoff annotation lines

        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the sentence/section segmenter class cannot be found
